verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Command the children of Israel, that they bring unto thee pure oil olive beaten for the light, to cause the lamps to burn continually.
verses.ct: "Give the Israelites this command: They must bring you pure pressed olive oil for the lamps, so the light can burn without interruption.

verses.kjv: Without the vail of the testimony, in the tabernacle of the congregation, shall Aaron order it from the evening unto the morning before the LORD continually: it shall be a statute for ever in your generations.
verses.ct: Aaron is to tend the lamps in the tabernacle of meeting, outside the curtain that hangs in front of the ark of the testimony. He must keep them burning from evening until morning in the LORD's presence without fail. This is a permanent regulation for all your future generations.

verses.kjv: He shall order the lamps upon the pure candlestick before the LORD continually.
verses.ct: He must always maintain the lamps on the pure gold lampstand in the LORD's presence.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt take fine flour, and bake twelve cakes thereof: two tenth deals shall be in one cake.
verses.ct: "You are to take fine flour and bake 12 loaves from it. Each loaf should contain 2/10 of an ephah of flour.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt set them in two rows, six on a row, upon the pure table before the LORD.
verses.ct: Arrange them in 2 rows of 6 on the pure gold table in the LORD's presence.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt put pure frankincense upon each row, that it may be on the bread for a memorial, even an offering made by fire unto the LORD.
verses.ct: Place pure frankincense on each row as a memorial portion, an offering by fire to the LORD.

verses.kjv: Every sabbath he shall set it in order before the LORD continually, being taken from the children of Israel by an everlasting covenant.
verses.ct: Every Sabbath day, the bread must be set out fresh in the LORD's presence. This is an ongoing responsibility provided by the Israelites as a lasting covenant.

verses.kjv: And it shall be Aaron’s and his sons’; and they shall eat it in the holy place: for it is most holy unto him of the offerings of the LORD made by fire by a perpetual statute.
verses.ct: The bread belongs to Aaron and his sons. They must eat it in the holy place, because it is an especially sacred portion of the offerings made by fire to the LORD. This is a permanent regulation."

verses.kjv: And the son of an Israelitish woman, whose father was an Egyptian, went out among the children of Israel: and this son of the Israelitish woman and a man of Israel strove together in the camp;
verses.ct: Now there was a man whose mother was an Israelite and whose father was an Egyptian. He went out among the Israelites, and a fight broke out in the camp between him and an Israelite man.

verses.kjv: And the Israelitish woman’s son blasphemed the name of the Lord, and cursed. And they brought him unto Moses: (and his mother’s name was Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan:)
verses.ct: The Israelite woman's son cursed and dishonored the name of the LORD. So they brought him to Moses. (His mother's name was Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri, from the tribe of Dan.)

verses.kjv: And they put him in ward, that the mind of the LORD might be shewed them.
verses.ct: They held him in custody until the LORD's decision could be made clear to them.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: Then the LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Bring forth him that hath cursed without the camp; and let all that heard him lay their hands upon his head, and let all the congregation stone him.
verses.ct: "Take the man who cursed outside the camp. Everyone who heard him must place their hands on his head, and then the entire community must stone him.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying, Whosoever curseth his God shall bear his sin.
verses.ct: Tell the Israelites: Anyone who curses their God will be held accountable for their sin.

verses.kjv: And he that blasphemeth the name of the LORD, he shall surely be put to death, and all the congregation shall certainly stone him: as well the stranger, as he that is born in the land, when he blasphemeth the name of the Lord, shall be put to death.
verses.ct: Anyone who dishonors the name of the LORD must be put to death. The entire community must stone that person. Whether they are a foreigner or a native-born citizen, if they dishonor the LORD's name, they must be executed.

verses.kjv: And he that killeth any man shall surely be put to death.
verses.ct: Anyone who takes another person's life must be put to death.

verses.kjv: And he that killeth a beast shall make it good; beast for beast.
verses.ct: Anyone who kills someone else's animal must replace it — one animal for another.

verses.kjv: And if a man cause a blemish in his neighbour; as he hath done, so shall it be done to him;
verses.ct: If someone injures their neighbor, the same must be done to them in return.

verses.kjv: Breach for breach, eye for eye, tooth for tooth: as he hath caused a blemish in a man, so shall it be done to him again.
verses.ct: Broken bone for broken bone, eye for eye, tooth for tooth — whatever injury someone inflicts on another person, the same must be inflicted on them.

verses.kjv: And he that killeth a beast, he shall restore it: and he that killeth a man, he shall be put to death.
verses.ct: Whoever kills an animal must replace it, but whoever kills a person must be put to death.

verses.kjv: Ye shall have one manner of law, as well for the stranger, as for one of your own country: for I am the LORD your God.
verses.ct: The same law applies to everyone — foreigners and native-born citizens alike. I am the LORD your God."

verses.kjv: And Moses spake to the children of Israel, that they should bring forth him that had cursed out of the camp, and stone him with stones. And the children of Israel did as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: Moses told the Israelites what to do, and they took the man who had cursed outside the camp and stoned him. The Israelites carried out exactly what the LORD had commanded Moses.
